description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of bracelets (reversible necklaces) with n beads, k of which are black and n-k are white.
comments: Equivalently, T(n,k) is the number of orbits of k-element subsets of the vertices of a regular n-gon under the usual action of the dihedral group D_n, or under the action of Euclidean plane isometries. Note that each row of the table is symmetric and unimodal. - _Austin Shapiro_, Apr 20 2009Also, the number of k-chords in n-tone equal temperament, up to (musical) transposition and inversion. Example: there are 29 tetrachords, 38 pentachords, 50 hexachords in the familiar 12-tone equal temperament. Called "Forte set-classes," after Allen Forte who first catalogued them. - _Jon Wild_, May 21 2004

formula: T(0,0) = 1. If n > 0, T(n,k) = C([n/2] - k mod 2 * (1 - n mod 2), [k/2]) / 2 + Sum_{d|n, d|k} (Phi(d)*binomial(n/d, k/d)) / (2n). - _Washington Bomfim_, Jun 30 2012
